name: places/ChIJR-dSP4xZwokRRxDXbLp2_kY
formattedAddress: 144 W 37th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: 144 W 37th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text:
Visited Restaurant Review: Manhattan Uyghur Restaurant | Tengri Tagh Uyghur Cuisine NYC | 天山美食, during my stay at New York. One of the standout features of Manhattan Uyghur Restaurant is its commitment to serving halal food, catering to a specific dietary preference and ensuring a diverse range of visitors can enjoy a delightful dining experience.
Food Quality and Variety (4.5/5): The restaurant's culinary offerings are a revelation for the taste buds. Each dish ordered, from the traditional Uyghur polo to the spicy chicken, showcases a unique flavor profile that is both new and delicious. The menu's diversity, including chicken mixed with spices braised in potatoes, stir-fried noodles, hand-pulled noodles, and dumplings, ensures there's something for every palate. The excellence in taste makes the dining experience truly phenomenal.
Ambience (3/5): While the restaurant's atmosphere is described as congested and crowded, the allure of the food compensates for any discomfort caused by the limited space. The focus on taste seems to overshadow any shortcomings in the ambience.
Signature Dishes (4/5): The traditional Uyghur polo, spicy chicken, and the uniquely spiced chicken braised in potatoes stand out as must-try dishes. The inclusion of stir-fried noodles, hand-pulled noodles, and dumplings adds a delightful variety to the culinary journey, making each visit an exploration of Uyghur cuisine.
Despite the crowded setting, Manhattan Uyghur Restaurant provides an overall exceptional dining experience. The delicious and unique flavors of Uyghur cuisine, coupled with the halal options, create a memorable visit for those seeking an authentic culinary adventure.
Manhattan Uyghur Restaurant is a gem for halal dining enthusiasts, offering a rich tapestry of flavors in Uyghur cuisine. The crowded ambiance is easily overshadowed by the phenomenal taste of each dish. From traditional favorites to unique specialties, this restaurant delivers a delicious and memorable experience for anyone willing to explore the diverse world of Uyghur flavors in the heart of New York City.

originalText.text: A small hole in the wall unique midtown place with additional 2nd floor seating. Very much threadbare in terms of furnishing. The dishes were served on paper plates or takeout containers. While inexpensive and delicious, the service could use a lot of improvement.

text.text: A small hole in the wall unique midtown place with additional 2nd floor seating. Very much threadbare in terms of furnishing. The dishes were served on paper plates or takeout containers. While inexpensive and delicious, the service could use a lot of improvement.

originalText.text:
One of the worst experience in New York so far, we sat down when there’re only two other tables at the restaurant, slow service speed, and no one tells you to order at the counter.
Then the server brought the other table’s food like roasted buns to us which I thought it’s complementary. Without explanation the other server came tried to take it away when I was eating. My friend doesn’t want bother so said we’ll pay for it. Again, no explanation and no apologies.
The chicken we ordered taste way too salty, the noodles were great and they’re hand pulled. And it’s really good value of money too.
The other thing I don’t like abt this place is they use all the disposable cutlery and containers, I guess no one really cares about sustainability.
Definitely a lot need to work on.

originalText.text: Ordered the noodles with chicken but it didn’t meet my expectation at all. Chicken was too salty and the taste of sichuan peppers was too strong. I feel it was pre cooked long time ago. The noodles were not freshly made as well. Although the noodle was brushed with oil to prevent it getting sticky and dry, it became too soft and lost the chewy texture. Lamb rice was just ok while the meat was too dry. I still give it 3 stars only because its not that expensive. At the price you can’t complain too much.

originalText.text: The most delicious food! I particularly love their hand pulled noodles which they make from scratch! Also their minced beef buns. And wonderful staff and ambiance.

text.text: The most delicious food! I particularly love their hand pulled noodles which they make from scratch! Also their minced beef buns. And wonderful staff and ambiance.
